about.description: Because writing HTML is fiddly and all of your tables are basically the same.
about.summary: HTML tables for use with the Flask micro-framework

name: flask_table
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "flask_table" %}
{% set version = "0.5.0" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/plumdog/{{ name }}/archive/v{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: bb8a15307cd4ea1f2b6be93b3ffe60a397099827439b4c389d624bf9c2939086

build:
  noarch: python
  number: 0
  script:
    - rd /s /q "docs"  # [win]
    - "{{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . --no-deps --ignore-installed --no-cache-dir -vvv"

requirements:
  host:
    - python
    - pip
  run:
    - python
    - flask
    - flask-babel

test:
  requires:
    - flask-testing
  source_files:
    - tests
  imports:
    - flask_table
  commands:
    - python -m unittest discover

about:
  home: https://pypi.org/project/Flask-Table/ 
  license: BSD-3-Clause
  license_family: BSD
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: 'HTML tables for use with the Flask micro-framework'
  description: |
    Because writing HTML is fiddly and all of your tables are basically the same.
  doc_url: https://flask-table.readthedocs.io
  dev_url: https://github.com/plumdog/flask_table

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - CurtLH
